results.firPara: Roy Keane had a piece of advice and, this being Roy Keane, it came with more than a hint of menace. Should the Republic of Ireland team know when and how to stop the game, the assistant manager was asked in advance of his countrys final and decisive Euro 2016 Group E tie against Italy on Wednesday.
results.secPara: Foul, you mean? Keane said. Yes. My advice would be Yeah, take them out. Were not here to make friends. The fans will do that. From a players point of view, if you smell danger and you think Were in trouble here, then yeah, you do whatever you can to get the right result. If thats a foul, then you foul him. Its not a crime. You might get a yellow card, you might even get a red but your team might win. Sacrifices. You have to make sacrifices for your team. Does that answer your question?
results.webTitle: Roy Keane before Italy clash: ‘Take them out. We’re not here to make friends’

results.firPara: • Sami Khedira and Thomas Schneider hit back at side lacks leaders claims
results.secPara: • Sami Khedira and Thomas Schneider hit back at side lacks leaders claims
results.webTitle: Germany dismiss criticism from former captain Michael Ballack as ‘comedy’

results.firPara: Laurent Blancs agent has confirmed that the Paris Saint-Germain coach will leave the club by the end of the week.
results.secPara: Nasser al-Khelaifi, the club president, hinted this month that he could be considering a change when he described their season as a failure despite achieving their second successive domestic treble by winning Ligue 1, the French Cup and the League Cup.
results.webTitle: Laurent Blanc to leave Paris Saint-Germain before the end of the week

results.firPara: Victor Wanyama is set to complete an £11m move from Southampton to Tottenham Hotspur after the clubs reached an agreement over the transfer fee. The Kenya midfielders medical and personal terms will follow in due course and neither is expected to be problematic.
results.secPara: Mauricio Pochettino, the Tottenham manager, is a long-term admirer of Wanyama, having worked with him when he was in charge at Southampton and he made an unsuccessful attempt to take him to White Hart Lane last summer.
results.webTitle: Tottenham to sign Victor Wanyama from Southampton in £11m deal

results.firPara: • Evans has signed one-year contract at League One club
results.secPara: Former Wales and Sheffield United striker Ched Evans has signed to play for Chesterfield, three months before he faces a retrial for rape.
results.webTitle: Chesterfield sign Ched Evans three months before rape retrial

results.firPara: Mamadou Sakho is expected to discover within the next three weeks whether he must serve a suspension for contravening Uefas drugs rules.
results.secPara: The Liverpool defenders career has been on hold since it was announced he failed a drug test following the Europa League tie at Manchester United on 17 March. The 26-year-old was initially taken out of the Liverpool side by the manager, Jürgen Klopp, and then provisionally suspended by Uefa for 30 days.
results.webTitle: Liverpool’s Mamadou Sakho to learn of possible drugs ban within three weeks

results.firPara: Got a minute? Digest the best of our latest coverage in the run-up to Euro 2016 as England and Wales set their sights on the knockout stages
results.webTitle: The Euro 2016 minute: England and Wales back in action

results.firPara: Uefa has told Italy and the Republic of Ireland that they will not be allowed to train at the Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille before their Group E game on Wednesday because of damage to the playing surface.
results.secPara: Instead both sides will train at their own bases on Tuesday before travelling to Lille. They will, however, be permitted to walk on the pitch before the game.
results.webTitle: Italy and Republic of Ireland not allowed to train on damaged Lille pitch
